conclusion: An empty coaxial capacitor of height l, inner radius a, and outer radius b is held at a fixed potential difference V.
The stored electrostatic energy U(l) is given by U(l) = ½ C V² = ½ [ 2π ε₀ l / ln(b/a) ] V².
The stored electrostatic energy simplifies to U(l) = (π ε₀ V² l) / ln(b/a).
The expression for stored energy is linear in the height l because every centimetre of the capacitor length contributes the same amount of capacitance before any fluid rises.
